Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Chicken AvBD2 (AvBD-2; OLD gallinacin 2, Gal-2, Gal 2, natural AMPs; avian beta-defensin, UCSS1a;  birds, animals; 3S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: intestinal epithelium and granulocytes, bone marrow,Gallus gallus

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli ML-35, L. monocytogenes strain EGD but not C.albicans till 400 ug/ml.Structure: It contains three disulfide bonds (C3-C29, C8-C23, and C13-C30). The seq has been verified by experiments (Derache et al 2009 Antimicrob Agents Chemother 55:4647-55). The 3D structure is determined by NMR and revealed no clear amphipathicity (see the PDB link below).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.MOA:bacteria: the peptide appears to target membranes as the D and L forms (D=L) showed similar activity against Gram- E. coli, S. enteritidis, and G+ bacteria B. cereus, and L. monocytogenes (Derache C et al. 2011 JBC).SAR: The structure of the K31A mutant has also been solved (View the mutant structure PDB 2LG6). Updated 12/2011; 2/2014; 4/2019; 7/2021 ; 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Harwig SS, Swiderek KM, Kokryakov VN, Tan L, Lee TD, Panyutich EA, Aleshina GM, Shamova OV, Lehrer RI.1994
Literature Information.Title: Gallinacins: cysteine-rich antimicrobial peptides of chicken leukocytes.
